title: 184.37 CONTRACTS WITH APPLICANTS FOR EMPLOYMENT.
text:
Every employment agent shall contract, in writing, with every applicant for employment for services to be rendered to the applicant by the employment agent, which contract shall contain the date, the name and address of the employment agency, the name of the employment agent, the service charge to be made to the applicant, and the time and method of payments. Every employment agent engaged in the placement of applicants shall also include on either the face or the back of the contract the definition of "accept," "method of payment," "temporary position," and "charge for permanent position which proves to be temporary."
MS 2002 [Repealed, 1Sp2001 c 4 art 2 s 41]
